comments:
Using Tomcat 4.1.24 for Solarus, 
Eclipse 3.0 M2 build on my PC
Apache version: 1.3.27 on the Unix

I'm trying to debug an servlet with the following debugging settings: 
host: pandemic.itc.nrcs.usda.gov port=5005

Tomcat has the following debug parms set as well:
JPDA_OPTS="-server -Xdebug -Xnoagent -Djava.compiler=NONE -Xrunjdwp:transpor
t=dt_socket,server=y,address=5005,suspend=n"

The problem is when I invoke the applet/servlet it never stops at my break 
point.  Has anyone experienced a problem like this?

Sun's Java Console spews out the following:
Clear classloader cache ... completed.

I'm in the search applet

java.lang.Exception

	at lib.url.URLChoiceList.<init>(URLChoiceList.java:36)

	at lib.awt.AwtSearchForm.<init>(AwtSearchForm.java:155)

	at lib.awt.AwtSearchApplet.init(AwtSearchApplet.java:19)

	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(AppletPanel.java:348)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

list_site; protocol=http; host=pandemic.itc.nrcs.usda.gov; port#=-1; query=null

IO Exception in input stream java.net.SocketException: Unexpected end of file 
from server

Did I get this far?

Buffered Read I/O exceptionjava.lang.NullPointerException

null

java.lang.NullPointerException

	at lib.url.URLChoiceList.<init>(URLChoiceList.java:78)

	at lib.awt.AwtSearchForm.<init>(AwtSearchForm.java:155)

	at lib.awt.AwtSearchApplet.init(AwtSearchApplet.java:19)

	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(AppletPanel.java:348)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

This program is attempting to hit an informix database that is up and 
available.  

Thanks for any/all help,
Dan

I verified breakpoints in remote targets are working in the M4 candidate build. 
This looks like a different problem - is your application even getting to the 
breakpoint (it looks like it dies before your code ever executes)?
